DOC.brief_summary: Working hypothesis and aims: The aim of our study is to investigate whether vitamin D deficiency could cause increased thrombin generation and a hypercoagulable state healthy volunteers. Methods: In total 400 healthy volunteers are planned for inclusion in this trial. After signing an informed consent two blood samples will be obtained from each participant. Expected results: invastigator expect to find that volunteers with vitamin D deficiency will have thrombin generation curve compatible with hypercoagulable state and returning to normal after treatment with vitamin D
DOC.brief_title: Does Deficiency in Vitamin D Induced Hypercoagulation or Thrombin Generation
DOC.criteria: age >18 healthy naive to drug treatment no exc criteria
